item.title: Report E-2024120244
item.description:
Report E-2024120244

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-16T12:32:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-18
  • City: SANTA FE SPRINGS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: At 11:05 ET, XPO notified the Call Center of a cargo release at terminal ULA. It was reported that approximately 12 ounces of Henry Pumadeq Flex 31MV released from one 5-gallon metal pale due to improper loading. The release impacted trailer #3214929. Call Center reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Chemtrec has been notified Chemtrec Report #2024111800060, POC: Joanne. Waste label 222195-1 was created, 55-gallon poly drum, containing original container, shrink wrap and paper towels used during clean up.

item.title: Report X-2024120588
item.description:
Report X-2024120588

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-13T15:15:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-10
  • City: ORANGE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Drums arrived to service center 151 and were unloaded. No damage or leaks were noted at the time. When the freight was being prepped to be loaded into another trailer, it was discovered that one of the drums was leaking from a seal. The leak is contained to the drum and the pallet the drum is on. Sa fety advised CURA would be contacted to send a crew out to clean the drum and inspect the seal and move the drum into a recovery drum if necessary.

item.title: Report E-2024120234
item.description:
Report E-2024120234

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-13T15:15:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-05
  • City: STOCKTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: J. B. HUNT TRANSPORT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the cardboard packaging and various freight that released form one (1) 1-gallon plastic jug. Clean Harbors personnel placed the impacted cardboard and leaking jug into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum along with their PPE. The various freight that had been impacted was containerized into one (1) additional 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was transported offsite for disposal.
